title: Hardhat has no exported member ethers
body:
Hi I am writing a script using typescript. I run with the hardhat runtime and it works as expected however typescript is saying that ethers is not exported from hardhat. How can I fix this?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5282495/124222288-4f0bab80-dab6-11eb-82b3-c7af2b7d4888.png)

I had to specify the scripts folder in the include field in tsconfig

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2017",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "declaration": true,
    "declarationMap": true,
    "sourceMap": true,
    "outDir": "./dist",
    "strict": true,
    "rootDirs": ["./src", "./scripts", "./test"],
    "esModuleInterop": true
  },
  "exclude": ["dist", "node_modules"],
  "include": ["./test", "./src", "./scripts"],
  "files": ["./hardhat.config.ts"]
}
```
Glad you figured it out and shared the solution before [the maintainers blamed your setup was wrong and instantly closed / locked your issue.](1640)

@supafreq You are right I shouldn't have locked that issue. To be honest I don't remember why I did it (I guess I wanted to move the discussion to Discord, but it was not a good idea in retrospect). With respect to closing it, we err on the side of closing issues instead of keeping them open for bookkeeping reasons. But again, that only makes sense if they can still be commented on, so my bad :slightly_smiling_face:
@BrennerSpear do you have a public repo that reproduces the problem?
Fixed it - I had to import `hre` explicitly since I'm using `ts-node` instead of `hardhat run`
Fixed it: have to install @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers
@BrennerSpear did you figure out how to run with `ts-node` instead of `hardat run` ?
@jogamod https://hardhat.org/guides/typescript.html#running-your-tests-and-scripts-directly-with-ts-node

> @BrennerSpear did you figure out how to run with `ts-node` instead of `hardat run` ?

I had to include `import hre from 'hardhat';` in my `deploy.ts` script
Okay, now I don't have errors when I run with `--files` but my token couldn't be minted (or any other contract method). When I try to do the same thing with `hardhat run`, it works...
adding `import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-waffle";` to `hardhat.config.ts` fixed it for me

Tried everything that's been suggested here and still Typescript was complaining.

But adding just one ts-node flag solved the issue for me :)

```
TS_NODE_FILES=true ts-node ./scripts/deploy-my-contract.ts
```

it is happening when tried to debug with viscose. 
normal command is working but if I config debugger, without import {ether} form 'hardhat', it is working well, but if I add this, it shows this message. 

test/index.ts:4:10 - error TS2305: Module '"hardhat"' has no exported member 'ethers'.

Installing ` npm install --save-dev @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers 'ethers@^5.0.0'` 
and adding `import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers";` in _deploy.ts_ fixed it for me.

> I had to specify the scripts folder in the include field in tsconfig
> 
> ```
> {
>   "compilerOptions": {
>     "target": "ES2017",
>     "module": "commonjs",
>     "declaration": true,
>     "declarationMap": true,
>     "sourceMap": true,
>     "outDir": "./dist",
>     "strict": true,
>     "rootDirs": ["./src", "./scripts", "./test"],
>     "esModuleInterop": true
>   },
>   "exclude": ["dist", "node_modules"],
>   "include": ["./test", "./src", "./scripts"],
>   "files": ["./hardhat.config.ts"]
> }
> ```

Thank you very much for your answer! It helped me.

> Installing ` npm install --save-dev @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers 'ethers@^5.0.0'` and adding `import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers";` in _deploy.ts_ fixed it for me.

this works, note that `ethers` needs to be in `devDependencies`, which the above will do

Thanks, its helped.
But `hardhat.config.ts` is compiling into dist folder along with others. How to compile it exclusively in project root?
Add `import "@nomicfoundation/hardhat-toolbox"` or `import "@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers"` to `hardhat.config.ts`.

This is enough:

```
  "include": ["next-env.d.ts", "**/*.ts", "**/*.tsx", "**/*.js"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules"]
```
